issue.title: add hint text to Search field in Palette

content.raw:
Unfortunately there is no SIGNAL click or focus for the QLineEdit (Search Field), hence the text cannot dissapear when the user clicks into the text field.

Now there are two possible solutions:

1. subclass QLineEdit and generate our own type, where a mouse click signal or focus signal on the text field is implemented.

2. User another SIGNAL of QLineEdit, for example when the user starts typing in text field the text disappears. 

Currently the last edit remains inside the text field throughout the use of the plotting utility. Do you want the hint text to appear again when user clicks somewhere else and search is done?

Furthermore if the user enters the Search Tab the focus is automatically given to the search field, so the text would immediately disappear. Perhaps if you want the text to remain a hint is not that useful (I found this post :D http://www.uxmatters.com/mt/archives/2010/03/dont-put-hints-inside-text-boxes-in-web-forms.php). 

However, the implementation is ready you just have to tell me if you prefer implementation 1 or 2.
